keyTakeAways: A man named Billy Joe Cagle was arrested at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport after being reported as armed and planning to 'shoot it up'.
Cagle was not armed at the time of arrest but an AR-15 assault rifle was found in his vehicle outside the airport.
He faces multiple state and federal charges, including terroristic threats, attempted aggravated assaults, and possession of a firearm by a convicted felon.
Cagle previously had a marijuana possession conviction over 20 years ago, indicating a prior criminal record.
The incident was described as a 'tragedy averted' by Atlanta Police Chief Darin Schierbaum, emphasizing the role of public vigilance and timely reporting.
Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport is the world’s busiest airport and a major hub for Delta Air Lines, making the incident a global concern due to its scale and significance.
FBI is assisting in the investigation, and Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem publicly commended law enforcement for preventing harm.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A man named Billy Joe Cagle, who lives in Cartersville, Georgia, was arrested at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport after his family alerted authorities that he was armed and planning to 'shoot it up'. Though not armed at the time of arrest, police found an AR-15 assault rifle in his vehicle. Cagle faces multiple state and federal charges, including terroristic threats, attempted aggravated assault, and possession of a firearm by a convicted felon. Authorities say he was already at the airport near the TSA check-in area shortly before 9:30 a.m., and his family had previously reported his armed status. The incident was described as a 'tragedy averted' by Atlanta Police Chief Darin Schierbaum, and the FBI is assisting in the investigation. The event highlights the critical importance of public vigilance, inter-agency coordination, and airport security, especially at the world’s busiest airport, which is also a major hub for Delta Air Lines. Federal officials, including Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem, praised law enforcement for preventing potential harm.
title: Man Arrested Inside Atlanta Airport After Making Threats to 'Shoot It Up'
